intro: Thlaspidium, commonly known as the glassy-winged sharpshooter, is a genus of planthoppers belonging to the family Cicadellidae. These insects are characterized by their transparent or glassy wings, which give them their common name. They are primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions, where they feed on the sap of various plants. Thlaspidium species are known for their role in transmitting plant pathogens, particularly those causing diseases in crops. Their botanical significance lies in their impact on agricultural health and their role in ecological interactions within their habitats.
